Title: App worked fine until the last release update
Review Text: There is much to be desired for the app but the last update made the app unusable. After each session the mendi icon shows up and gets stuck there. Only way to get pass this screen is to close the app and restart it. I see other people are experiencing the same behavior. Seems like this got passed QA somehow. Not terribly impressed with the app. Please fix this ASAP or I‚Äôll have to move on to alternatives.

Title: Workout for my Brain
Review Text: The device is super simple to use and It‚Äôs comfortable when snug on your forehead. The ‚Äúgame‚Äù is interesting because it‚Äôs a cool visual representation of my ability to focus. Another way to put it is that it‚Äôs a visual representation of your brains activity when attempting to focus on a task or a visual representation of the brain during meditation. I really like the feedback and the ability to compare past sessions to current. It took about a week or so before I really started noticing small improvements in focus and I do mean small subtle but effective improvements. With patience and consistency I feel strongly that this device will really help with my focus, anxiety, stress and sleep. It‚Äôs going to take time and I won‚Äôt develop some cool super powers but I am finally able to train my brain and see/feel the improvements.

Title: Very helpful!!!
Review Text: I see more and more little improvements in myself the longer I use it. Like, I am more willing to get things done that I dislike doing around the house or with my budget. I am becoming more focused at work. I notice I am getting better at not being triggered at some things and I am recovering quicker at the things that do still get me. I have been using it for about a month now. The other day I was hit with hard information and I was actually able to say, I am done worrying about this tonight and chose to go to sleep and actually slept without my mind racing all night or preventing me from going to sleep. That was huge. I also am noticing more when I am being critical towards other. Like it is bringing awareness to me so I can change it. I think it will also help me change it the more I use it. I catch myself breathing more through stressful moments helping them be less stressful. This thing is a miracle that come in a box. It is so easy to use and I have my whole family using it. Thank you mendi!! I have done neurofeedback before to help with a head injury. I am so grateful for the price of this vs that, and the convenience of having it be in the home or wherever I want to do it. Thank you thank you thank you! Using this device is literally helping my marriage get better!! Bit by bit as we both use it. Those reading this, you have to give it the time and consistency but it is such an easy thing to do. I do miss a day or two a week and still get amazing results so you dont have to be perfect but it is sooo worth the little effort it takes to do it!

Title: Firefighter/Medic
Review Text:
I‚Äôm a medically retired firefighter/medic with diagnosed ADHD, PTSD, general anxiety, and depression.  I underwent treatments including EMDR, hypnotherapy, CBT, and DBT.  I was prescribed alpha stimulation to help manage nightmares, irrational fears, suicidal ideations, and sleep deprivation (essentially shock therapy).  I have learned that meditation and exercise historically helped me the most.  Then Mendi came screaming across feed. I bought in because of a rudimentary familiarity with brain function in a PTSD brain (with skepticism). 

Ultimately, I love this tool and am finding myself meditating with it more than without it.  I love seeing how my sessions are monitored.  I also feel more relaxed after my sessions.  I had my 10th session over the last two weeks today and I can visualize how my focus is improving.

I can‚Äôt confirm Mendi is responsible for helping me quit chewing, but my curbed desire for alcohol and nicotine appear to have a correlation with the use of Mendi. I am far less interested in stimulants than I have been in a long time.  

I am recommending this tool for further investigation from my union to aid in first responder mental health training and treatments.

Title: Life changer
Review Text:
This neuro feedback tool has definitely changed my life. The best way to put it is: between a stimulus and a response there‚Äôs a gap. Mendi helps you creating and staying in that gap, so that you can take more conscious decisions. 
A quick example: I had been biting my nails for basically all my life. Then I started training with Mendi. I know recognise the triggers and completely stopped biting my nails. I still bring my fingers close to my mouth at times, but then I‚Äôm in that gap and I take the conscious decision to don‚Äôt do it.

It‚Äôd be nice to see if the guys at mendi can create some new games to play with the headband.

Title: At 20 days
Review Text: So in the 20 days I‚Äôve noticed some better focus at work. I‚Äôm able to stay on one project longer without feeling the need to jump to another. I‚Äôm remembering more of my dreams after waking up too.  Looking forward to some more progress to give a five star.

Title: Just started, but I wish there were more info.
Review Text: I have only just begun using Mendi, so I can‚Äôt speak to results yet. I find the app, informative, and interesting. However, I wish there were more information about the scores. The explanation on the website is filled with vague hedges. Basically, it says your score doesn‚Äôt matter as much as your improvement. But it doesn‚Äôt even quantify what a good improvement would be. While I understand a ‚Äúgood‚Äù score might vary widely depending on age and preexisting health conditions (adhd, depression,‚Ä¶ etc),  and lifestyle (exercise, diet, substance use/abuse, etc.), it would be great if they could present us with some averages and means( baselines based on age and categories people self identify they are trying to improve). They must have a significant amount of data at this point, and the fact that they are not willing to share this data does not instill me with confidence.

Title: I love Mendi!
Review Text: I have had Mendi for more than 2 years now. Currently I‚Äôm on a 41 day streak. My mood, well-being, productivity, and many other aspects are better because of using Mendi. I notice little things all the time that are without a doubt improvements. Everything is better, sometimes a little, sometimes a lot better. I love to play golf. Doing a 10 minute Mendi session before golfing produces a mental focus that maintains itself throughout my entire round, which I love. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about Mendi.

Title: Surprising Results
Review Text:
In the summer of 2023, I suffered a concussion. I had severe vertigo, headaches, limited mental bandwidth and my emotional regulation, which had been above average, deteriorated to almost non-existent within weeks. I realized I needed to take action to aid my recovery.

After extensive research, I decided Mendi was the most suitable brain training device for my rehab. I purchased the device about 9-10 months after the injury, just before this last summer.

Although I haven‚Äôt been as disciplined as I‚Äôd like, my scores have improved, and my ability to focus has increased significantly. Not only has Mendi helped me return to baseline, but it has also enhanced my emotional regulation beyond what it was before the concussion.

I can quantify this improvement because I used to experience significant fear while rock climbing outdoors‚Äîa reasonable physiological response. This past summer, while I did feel some fear, it was about 20% as intense. Even in the most extreme situations, I was able to dial it back and recompose myself. In many cases, I felt no fear at all, which was a completely new experience for me since I started climbing.

I‚Äôm surprised this app doesn‚Äôt have more reviews. Mendi is a game changer. I‚Äôm incredibly grateful for this product and would love to see more gamification features to encourage consistent training.

Title: It got me started again

So it helped me get back to mindfulness. It has already helped me identify new pre-flow creative state triggers. However after few months of use it is no longer helpful.
I could get the same good score on two sessions. The first session I had high neutral activity, oxygen and focus. The second session I had poor scores in all these areas. So the score really only measures commitment to the app which is unhelpful for neurofeedback and brain training.

Title: loving it so far!
Review Text: Love my Mendi so far!! Using it as an alternative to in office treatment for my sleep disorder (makes me constantly tired, long sleep times) and adhd. One suggestion would be the ability to change the sound, the background image, or other visuals such as the ball you are rolling. I guess this could potentially lead to distraction, but some customization would be great

Title: Great meditation tech
Review Text:
I love the Mendi head band and doing the exercises. It really helps get the most out of meditation. 

I would love to see a few extra features on the app to help track progress like graphing of performance score, general score, peak neural activation, max control periods, total and average sessions times, etc all mapped over varying time periods. It would really bring this app to the next level for me.

At the moment, tracking performance is awkward and you can only look at a single session at a time and can‚Äôt see that progress over time.

Some more creative and limited time badges, even monthly ones would be a nice addition too but not as important and the graphing.

Title: Streak Saver?
Review Text:

However, I get disheartened when I lose my streak (it‚Äôs common for me to stay up past midnight, and the mendi is a part of my bedtime routine). Losing my streak sometimes makes it feel harder to start again from 0. 

Perhaps some sort of streak saver would work well for others like me, much like the ones that exist in other apps designed for daily practice.

Title: Lots of fun.

Title: Brain Gym
Review Text:
If nothing else, this device helps you train your positive thinking muscles and to let go and overcome your negative thinking patterns! When the ball starts to fall, your negative thinking really kicks in and this is a great tool to help notice when it does and to try different thoughts out. I‚Äôve been using mendi for about one year now and I am convinced my day turns out better when I use mendi. Typically use it once a day for a 10min session. Using it is almost like an active meditation in that you seem to do better with a light concentration rather than willful concentration. When I try to ‚Äúwill‚Äù the ball up, it doesn‚Äôt seem to work to well. But when I focus on a specific spot on my body and relax my breathing, it seems to rise better. I dont know why that is or if it is unique to me. 
But I like using mendi, and I like the ‚ÄúJourneys ‚Äú section they added. Winnerminds has some good meditations to go along with mendi. 
I recommend anyone getting it.

Title: Meditation Measured
Review Text: Always struggled with keeping sustainable focus during meditation. Also great to get the feedback. Feel less relaxed than after meditation. Probably need 5 mins of interoceptive meditation also afterwards.. Love this thing!

Title: What?  I can‚Äôt download to my iPad?
Review Text:
I have an IPad Pro.  Large screen.  Totally would have loved to have put this on my iPad.  Hopefully, that will change.  
I haven‚Äôt used it enough yet to really say if I like it or not.  I used it last night and then tonight, I forgot my phone downstairs so I thought, no biggie.  I can just put it on my iPad Pro.  It‚Äôs even better because of the screen size.  That was a fail.   I hope they can fix that.  
I am excited to use this daily though.  I need help focusing.

Title: Amazing
Review Text:
So cool that we have home devices like this now. I think you could have better on boarding baked into the sessions when you start, I had to seek out how the positive reinforcement actually works and its explained in day 4 of a video series, but that info should be drip fed through the first few sessions because it helps you immensely.

After I started trying to ‚Äúfeel happy‚Äù when ball goes up, and ‚Äúfeel bad‚Äù when ball goes down, thats what trains the subconscious to prefer better blood flow.

That part was missed, and took me 2 weeks to figure out as I was poking around and playing with the app.

My gf asked how does it work? I had no idea and couldn‚Äôt explain it to her‚Ä¶ but now I can because I watched that video series.

Title: Consistency is key!
Review Text: We got the Mendi almost a year ago during Black Friday, we got a $100 discount which was great. I really like that the app is free and several people can use the same device without having to pay any additional fees for subscriptions. At first I was spotty with my Mendi practice but as I have become more consistent I have noticed greater improvement with my overall scores. Beyond the scores, I am an adult male with ADHD and have found that my mood has improved as well as my ability to focus on everyday tasks. I would recommend the Mendi for anyone who has a desire to improve their mental health. I would love to see Mendi introduce more games so there is a variety in the brain training. It would also be  cool to see more statistics to track improvement over time.

Review Text: I recently bought a Mendi headset, I think this app works really well. One item I wish the app would do, is write mindfulness data to HealthKit, so your time shows up within the health app.

Title: App needs work to make it more useful
Review Text: I got the Mendi about 10 days ago and I‚Äôve been using it every day. I‚Äôm still figuring out how to control the ball - clearly that requires some mental experimentation. I believe I‚Äôve made progress and almost all days, my assessment of the session matches, qualitatively, my Mendi score. There were some surprises tho. On my first session this afternoon, I was thinking about something stressful at work and became very agitated. I looked at the ball and, during that time, it was gyrating wildly, going steeply up for a little bit and then falling steeply into the depths. It was like the ball was riding needles up and down! I fully expected my Mendi session to have a low score, but to my surprise, I got my highest score ever at 90 and my highest ever area under the graph! That was puzzling and a little disturbing because I did not expect, or want, my scores to be high when I was agitated and my frontal lobe completely out of my conscious control! Not sure if this is an actionable item but i wanted to put it out there in the hope that it‚Äôs a useful tidbit. Couple fixes and changes I‚Äôd like: Id like to be able to see all my numbers and plots for a session even if it isn‚Äôt the best session of the day. Right now it only gives you hints of what your numbers could be by showing you part of each number, with no way of clicking on them and seeing them fully! The second is that the app has frozen on me a couple of times after using it, when I try to scroll up and down.

Review Text:

Title: Oliver
Review Text:
The new start training button feels more intuitive but‚Ä¶ If I‚Äôm not wrong, it is not visible any more after I have trained for one session. It appears again once a new day starts. This way I don‚Äôt get the ability to do a second or third session later on the same day. 
For the rest the app looks and works great.

Title: Super buggy and laggy
Review Text: There is high chance that if you reading this you have already fallen in their trap and even if you try to come out with their 30 days money back promise you will come to know there catch! There is Very little you can do with the app. It has only one game which work with its device and it also has a lag which makes it harder to really work with this brain feedback phenomenon. There score system is buggy. Inshort when they say you are doing good even if not in real you have to believe so and same thing other way around. No apple health support as well.

Title: Would have given five stars
Review Text: Mendi has helped me with my focus and think it does what it claims.  But I have to say that their customer service is the worst. It matters because the software is buggy. It registers the wrong day, doesn‚Äôt recognize that I‚Äôve completed a session, and some of the scores appear random‚Äîthe exact same scores on the three metrics but different scores overall. I want to be a fan and talk it up, but the customer service department has gone out of their way to make that impossible.

Title: Would not fully connect
Review Text: I‚Äôm a Ph.D pyschologist very familiar with neurofeedback and I was excited to try this device. Unfortunately I could not get it to work on my iPhone 12. It connected to the app but the sensors never turned on once the headband was in place. Very disappointed. NF-Guy

Title: Did not record
Review Text: New update won‚Äôt record your latest training result if you trained more than one session a day.

Title: Feedback for the devs
Review Text:
Hello! Thank you for your continued work on the app. I look forward to seeing it expand with more content and different games. I have a couple issues and suggestions:

I dislike the chime tone. It reminds me of casinos and I end up turning my volume all the way off to avoid it. A variety of tones to choose from or the option to turn off the chimes while still having the music would be great.
The visual display that comes up after a session rarely displays the Mendi score at this point. I have the most recent update. I usually receive a message instead to do a session or swipe to see my history. I can still see the individual metrics below, but the inconsistency and not knowing how to compare with previous results makes me less enthusiastic to use the app and has led to gaps in training. It seems to post the results twice, actually now that I look at it again, but the date is inaccurate. I trained today but not yesterday, however today‚Äôs results are displayed with both yesterday‚Äôs and today‚Äôs dates, yesterday having the visual Mendi score and today having the message to do a session or swipe left

Title: App performs worse with each new release.
Review Text: After achieving some notable success in training my brain with this app, I have noticed a recent update has slowed the performance of starting and ending a session. Now I find I can‚Äôt even start a session as the app freezes on the screen requesting I rotate my screen to start. No matter what I do with the screen orientation I can‚Äôt get the session to start.  :-(

Title: Not enough variety
Review Text: Mendi doesn‚Äôt have enough variety. It is currently only the ball game and one music piece. For something you are encouraged to do at least 3 times a week 5 minutes a session, I wish there was more. For the price, I feel this hurts the experience and desire to use it.

Title: Constant improvements
Review Text: The app is improving constantly which is very exciting and great to see. I do however wish there were more games/challenges to mix it up a bit.

Title: Simple
Review Text: But effective ‚Äî love the device itself, it‚Äôs designed so well.  App isn‚Äôt feature heavy, but it‚Äôs maturing; awesome product

Title: Apps works well, but it is slow to load some UI
Review Text:
Update:  I contacted support and was told that the delays on some screens was due to backend server load issues that are being addressed. This does seem to explain the issues I am/was seeing:

1) Initial screen when starting a session - the ‚Äúbutton‚Äù for selecting me vs a guest is slow to fill in with my name and let me start a session. 

2) ‚ÄúRotate to landscape‚Äù prompt is slow to respond after rotation and then load the start of a session. 

3) The end of a session appears hung, but does eventually load the concluding screens of a session. 

It would seem to make sense to display some sort of animation at these junctures that shows the user that the app is still running, and not broken. Perhaps some sort of background asynchronous communication/loading could also make the app appear more responsive. 

All told, I‚Äôm happy with the app and the Mendi headband device. I hope more customization of the session experience will be added in the future. 

It would be nice to have additional choices of background music, to play your own music, or turn off music. It might be nice to have a more beautiful background than the current sky/color gradient, such as actual natural imagery: sky, forest, or a coastal landscape. I wonder if some other changing focus image other than the spinning ball, like a fountain/jet of water, a point or sphere of light, or perhaps something purely aural - a fluctuating sound such a variable frequency filter over brown/white/pink noise. 

I‚Äôm still working with the system and look forward to getting better at using it, and hope the user experience will be improved/made more customizable. 

============
The Mendi app seems to be working well, but at the end of a training session the app hangs on a blank (colored, but no UI) screen. I need to go to the iOS app switcher, swipe it away, and restart it. The app shows that my session activity is recorded, but this clearly isn‚Äôt a good user experience. I‚Äôm doing a 10 minute session, running iOS 15.5, on an iPhone 13 Pro Max with 256 GB storage. The Mendi app version is v1.19.0.2205101542. Device model V4, Hardware version r2.1a-ty1, Firmware 1.0.2

Title: App issues
Review Text:
I have had  Mendi for a week now and here is my review. 

The device works well and I like it so far, very easy to use with a awesome design. 

However, the app has issues with the login page, I need to login several times to get in, it also takes a long time loading to get your results after a session. 

I hope they can fix this soon!

Title: Very glitchy experience
Review Text: App has gotten completely glitchy. Have to click buttons multiple times to get to training session (get dropped back several times). Just completed a training session and after finishing it just go back to starting a new one without recording results. Apart from that there is the problem that the measurement method constantly seems to change. Whenever I I think I get a hold of how to control the ball, the criteria seem to change with a software update and I am starting from square zero again. Very inconsistent and frustrating. Almost ready to give up on the device.

Title: Very slow after some use
Review Text:
I have used my mendi for around 10 days (once or sometimes twice a day) and the app has already become very slow. End screen that shows result from current session does not show anymore even, have to kill the app to get past what is now an empty purple screen. Luckily the results are still stored.

Please fix performance. I don‚Äôt want to end up having to reinstall every week, losing the data, just to have it less sluggish.

Other than that i‚Äôd say the concept works! Placebo or not but i really feel that i can control the ball better and better, and feeling better also, especially after a good session

Title: Login
Review Text: Login, login, login, always these f**ing logins. Down the garbage bin this Mendi goes.

Title: Love!!!
Review Text:
Has helped with focus so much. I do wish there were more games, but for the price, I am very happy with it! 

I use to supplement my in office neurofeedback, as I can afford to go in as much anymore. Mendi is a cost effective way to get those benefits!!!

Title: Umm‚Ä¶who was I 3 months ago?
Review Text:
I Love My MENDI. 

I‚Äôm giving four stars for now because the app has room for growth. Custom durations PLEASE PLEASE
PLEASE. Obviously, new practice games.  An API for devs. 

I LOVE MY MENDI

Does It Work? You betcha. Best meditations of my life. You so won‚Äôt be sorry if you buy a Mendi. 

If used regularly, you will wonder how you ever lived without this tool. I almost purchased a different kind of BCI. I chose MENDI (Best decision). In time, I‚Äôm sure I will try other products but I‚Äôm confident MENDI will always be my go to for my main practice. I suffer from ADHD and severe anxiety which means the typical medications. Been on them for years yet I‚Äôve never felt as good as I do right now. 
I Love My MENDI

In February, the one preceding the original March pandemic madness, I lost my mother to cancer. She was my mom, rock, and she was my best friend too. I‚Äôm 41 now and have not had a job for 15 years or drove a car in who knows. Up to last year I had never lived alone. I‚Äôd never lived outside of the house I grew up in. My entire life has been fighting my mental health issues. Now  I‚Äôm a child trying to learn how to live like an adult. It isn‚Äôt easy. I have practiced a lot over the years but never long-term habit before. I look forward to time using MEMDI Then I met MENDI.

 I LOVE MY MENDI. 

I thank everyone at MENDI for this product. I don‚Äôt know how I could ever express my gratitude. You guys saved my life. Anything I can do to help
you guys, I‚Äôd be honored. I‚Äôd be happy to take part in any beta testing, clinical studies, research studies, learning paths, whatever it be. 

I Love My Mendi

Title: Great product, very limited app
Review Text: Mendi is a game changer to be sure, but the app is disappointingly limited. Maximum session duration is arbitrarily 15 minutes. I am using Mendi to augment my meditation practice and 15 minutes is a short sit for me. Explanations for how the exercise works are lacking substance - neurofeedback is backed by solid science, but the instructions for how to do it in the app are all a bit fluffy. A ‚Äúrating‚Äù option would also be good for when taking notes. These are my first impressions after a week. Looking forward to future improvements so I can give a 5 star rating!

Title: Arrived!
Review Text: My Mendi was delivered on Wednesday, July 7, 2021. Arrived it perfect condition, well packaged, beautifully made, and was a snap to setup. It took seconds for it to locate and connect with the free app. In fact, it took longer to download the app than it took to setup and begin using.  Entire process is incredibly intuitive. Having only been three days, it‚Äôs too soon to boast about any improvements, but I am certain I am feeling something going on in my head. Having read about the benefits of neuro-feedback in the book, ‚ÄúThe Body Keeps The Score,‚Äù by Bessel Van der Kolk MD, I am excited by the possibilities of the benefits of consistent daily practice with Mendi. I have high hopes for this device and its training.
